sn47.95-104:4.3: Desire for rebirth in the realm of luminous form, desire for rebirth in the formless realm, conceit, restlessness, and ignorance.
sn47.95-104:4.4: These are the five higher fetters.
sn47.95-104:4.5: The four kinds of mindfulness meditation should be developed for the direct knowledge, complete understanding, finishing, and giving up of these five higher fetters.
sn47.95-104:5.2: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.95-104:5.3: They meditate by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.95-104:5.5: principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.95-104:5.6: These four kinds of mindfulness meditation should be developed for the direct knowledge, complete understanding, finishing, and giving up of these five higher fetters.”
sn47.95-104:7.1: (The Linked Discourses on Mindfulness Meditation should be expanded as in the Linked Discourses on the Path.)
sn47.95-104:9.4: aggregates, and fetters high and low.
sn47.95-104:10.1: The Linked Discourses on Mindfulness Meditation
